caption.title: A selection of terms that combine a Greek preposition and the suffix -genome.
caption.p: Some terms that the authors believe could be useful in genome biology.

tr.td: could be used to describe usage over time, to monitor population variation
could be used to describe polyploid genomes, and sex differences
could be used to convey non-DNA large scale analysis
could be a useful concept for comparative genomics
could be a useful term for substance use
could be a vey useful term to describe developmental processes over time
could be used to describe the genomics of paralogs (although this is not satisfactory from an etymological point of view)
could be a very useful term to describe developmental processes over space
could be used to describe synthetic genomes
could be used to describe the genomics of symbioses
could be used to describe a synthetic genome with depleted functions – as opposed to hyper-genome to describe a synthetic genome with added functions
